title: Why Python Is Great 2 for Backend Development just for you
content: Python's simplicity and powerful libraries make it ideal for building scalable backend systems. What do you mean? I dont know!
author: Martin Haferanke
comments: This post convinced me to switch.

title: Understanding RESTful APIs
content: REST is a design pattern for APIs that relies on standard HTTP methods. Here's how it works.
author: Anna Schmidt
comments: Can you do one for GraphQL?

title: Implementing Rate Limiting in Flask
content: Learn how to use Flask-Limiter to protect your API from abuse by limiting requests.
author: Lukas Fischer
comments: Will this work with FastAPI too?

title: How to Handle CORS in Flask
content: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) can be tricky. Here's how to set it up properly in Flask.
author: Sophie Keller
comments: Now my frontend is finally talking to the backend.

title: Deploying Flask Apps to Heroku
content: This post guides you through deploying a Flask application to Heroku using Git and the Heroku CLI.
author: Jonas Weber
comments: I had issues with the Procfile tho.

title: Testing Flask APIs with Postman
content: Learn how to use Postman to test your Flask-based REST API endpoints effectively.
author: Maria Braun
comments: Can you cover automated tests next?

title: JWT Authentication with Flask
content: Explore how to implement JSON Web Token authentication in your Flask application using Flask-JWT-Extended.
author: Felix Neumann

title: Using SQLAlchemy with Flask
content: SQLAlchemy makes database integration easy in Flask. Here's how to define models and interact with your database.
author: Laura Meier

title: Flask vs FastAPI: Which One Should You Choose?
content: We compare Flask and FastAPI across performance, ease of use, and ecosystem to help you decide.
author: David Hoffmann
